title: Relates to proceeds from prepaid telephone calling cards
summary: Requires revenue from the sale of prepaid telephone calling cards to be deposited in an escrow account; provides that such revenue may only be withdrawn to the extent the holders of such cards use the authorized telephone service.

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the public service law, in relation to proceeds from
         prepaid telephone calling cards

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 92-f of the public service law is amended by adding
    2  a new subdivision 9 to read as follows:
    3    9.  ANY PREPAID TELEPHONE CALLING CARD DISTRIBUTOR WHO OFFERS OR SELLS
    4  TO THE PUBLIC IN OR FROM THE STATE OF NEW YORK SHALL, NO LATER THAN  THE
    5  NEXT BUSINESS DAY AFTER RECEIPT THEREOF, DEPOSIT ALL SUCH PROCEEDS IN AN
    6  ESCROW  ACCOUNT  IN  A  BANK,  TRUST  COMPANY, SAVINGS BANK, OR STATE OR
    7  FEDERAL SAVINGS AND LOAN ASSOCIATION,  LOCATED  IN  THIS  STATE.  MONIES
    8  DEPOSITED  IN  ESCROW SHALL BE RELEASED UPON USE OF SUCH CARDS FOR WHICH
    9  SUCH MONIES HAVE BEEN DEPOSITED TO THE EXTENT THAT SUCH MONIES REPRESENT
   10  PAYMENT FOR PREPAID TELEPHONE CALLING CARDS SOLD. SUCH MONIES  SHALL  BE
   11  RELEASED  TO  LONG  DISTANCE TELEPHONE CARRIERS AT THE TIME SUCH PREPAID
   12  CALLING CARD IS PURCHASED. EACH PREPAID TELEPHONE CALLING CARD  CUSTOMER
   13  SHALL,  UNTIL  USE  OF  SUCH  CARD,  RETAIN  A PROPERTY INTEREST IN THAT
   14  PORTION OF THE DEPOSIT WHICH EQUALS THE AMOUNT  HE  HAS  PAID  FOR  SUCH
   15  CARD.
   16    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first day of the calendar month
   17  next  succeeding  the thirtieth day after it shall have became a law and

   19  such effective date.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2247

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the public service law, in relation to proceeds from prepaid
telephone calling cards

SUMMARY:
This legislation would require telephone prepaid calling card
distributors who offer or sell in or from the state of New York to
deposit all such proceeds in an escrow account in a bank, trust
company, savings bank, or state or federal savings and loan
association in this state. Monies deposited in escrow shall be
released upon use of such cards to long distance carriers. Until such
use of said cards the customer shall retain a property interest in
that portion of the deposit which equals the amount he has paid for
such card.

JUSTIFICATION:
The purchaser of the prepaid calling card (and not the prepaid calling
card distributor) should rightfully retain the benefit of property
interest in the amount he/she has paid until requested services are
rendered.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect on the first day of the calendar month
next succeeding
the thirtieth day after it shall have became a law and
shall apply to any prepaid calling cards sold or distributed on or after
such effective date.
